call_title: Ergo PoW Blockchain - Weekly Update & AMA - January 30th

topics.title: Cornell BRICK Token Recycling Economy
topics.summary: QX discusses expanding the Cornell BRICK token system to incentivize students to recycle large architectural plots by rewarding them with BRICK tokens. The system creates a circular economy where recycled plots earn tokens that can be used to pay for new printing services.

topics.title: Monetary Innovation and Storage Rent Discussion
topics.summary: Kushti compares the BRICK recycling model to traditional crypto airdrops and discusses how storage rent creates value from digital waste recycling. They highlight a recent $20,000 ERG/PHP token collection through storage rent as an example of blockchain waste monetization.

topics.title: Storage Rent Mechanics and Mining Pool Implementation
topics.summary: Discussion of how storage rent collection works, clarifying that anyone can collect storage rent transactions but miners can replace them with their own. Currently only Sigmanauts pool actively collects storage rent, with individual developers also participating through sniping.

topics.title: Argentina Mining Operations and Lithium Index
topics.summary: Dan reports on Palmyra's lithium index development and potential mining secretary appointment in Argentina. He discusses a large Bitcoin ASIC mining operation that could potentially support Ergo if converted to GPU mining.

topics.title: Palmyra Team Expansion with Ergo Developers
topics.summary: Dan announces that Palmyra has hired multiple Ergo ecosystem developers including Pyro and Luivatra, creating an 'Ergo All-Stars' team. This provides financial support for developers during the bear market while leveraging trusted talent from the Ergo community.

topics.title: Ergo 6.0 Development and Testnet Progress
topics.summary: Kushti provides updates on Ergo 6.0 development including sub-blocks implementation and API methods. All issues from 6.0 have been fixed and they're preparing for public testnet release, with QX confirmed as the current testnet miner.

topics.title: DEX Development Synchronization Challenges
topics.summary: Kushti discusses ongoing challenges with synchronizing DEX front-end and back-end development teams to complete UI and deployment. He's working to get developers in sync for final delivery.

topics.title: DAO Proposals and Oracle Pool Governance
topics.summary: Discussion of various DAO initiatives including Palmyra's business development DAO and proposed specialized DAOs for gold and lithium oracle pool operators. These would provide more transparent governance for reward distribution and decision-making in specific niches.

topics.title: Hong Kong Conference and Ecosystem Vision
topics.summary: Plans for Hong Kong visit in February to meet with major Asian VCs and check market temperature. Discussion of organizing a Palmyra-Ergo event to attract fresh participants and connect with existing Hong Kong Ergonauts from 2019.

topics.title: Rosen Bridge and Hydra Layer 2 Integration
topics.summary: Charles Hoskinson's positive views on Rosen Bridge and potential integration with Cardano's Hydra layer 2 solution. Hydra could significantly reduce on-chain load for federated protocols like Rosen Bridge and Oracle pools by 20x in optimistic scenarios.

topics.title: Miners Rights Protocol and Privacy Features
topics.summary: Explanation of Mark the Shark's Miners Rights Protocol which uses tokens to designate mining rights to pools and enable rewards distribution. The protocol offers privacy benefits and could enable NFT-based mining configuration management instead of centralized websites.

topics.title: SigmaUSD Oracle Pool Participation and Upgrades
topics.summary: Current SigmaUSD Oracle pool has only 4-5 participants due to lack of incentivization. Plans for version 2 upgrade with reward tokens and discussion of dust consolidation issues in version 1. Gold Oracle pool operates more successfully with 14-18 active operators out of 20 maximum.
